articles.headline: Qualcomm Scraps $44 Billion NXP Deal After China Inaction
articles.snippet: The transaction failed after a series of trade moves by the Trump administration, including tariffs on numerous Chinese goods, and retaliatory measures from China.
articles.abstract: The transaction failed after a series of trade moves by the Trump administration, including tariffs on numerous Chinese goods, and retaliatory measures from China.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Qualcomm called off its $44 billion deal to buy NXP Semiconductors after Chinese regulators did not rule on the transaction amid a trade war between Washington and Beijing.

articles.headline: U.S. and Europe Outline Deal to Ease Trade Feud
articles.snippet: The surprise announcement included an agreement to work toward lower tariffs. But given President Trump’s negotiating style, it was hard to say if the deal was a genuine truce.
articles.abstract: The surprise announcement included an agreement to work toward lower tariffs. But given President Trump’s negotiating style, it was hard to say if the deal was a genuine truce.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The United States and the European Union stepped back from the brink of a trade war on Wednesday, after President Trump said the Europeans agreed to work toward lower tariffs and other trade barriers, and to buy billions of dollars of American soybeans and natural gas.
articles.byline: By Mark Landler and Ana Swanson

articles.headline: Facebook Starts Paying a Price for Scandals
articles.snippet: The social network said that advertising and user growth slowed in the second quarter, and that efforts to improve privacy would stunt profits further. Its stock price tumbled.
articles.abstract: The social network said that advertising and user growth slowed in the second quarter, and that efforts to improve privacy would stunt profits further. Its stock price tumbled.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — For nearly two years, Facebook has appeared bulletproof despite a series of scandals about the misuse of its giant social network.

articles.headline: The Latest Hot E-Commerce Idea in China: The Bargain Bin
articles.snippet: China is getting richer, and its economy is going higher-end. But the online bazaar Pinduoduo has found that plenty of people still love cheap stuff.
articles.abstract: China is getting richer, and its economy is going higher-end. But the online bazaar Pinduoduo has found that plenty of people still love cheap stuff.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — Apple, Gucci, Tesla. Many Chinese shoppers love their top-shelf brands.

articles.headline: Representing Michael Cohen, ‘Classic Lanny’ Davis Comes Out Swinging
articles.snippet: Mr. Davis — an all-purpose lawyer, lobbyist, crisis consultant and TV-talker — has helped Mr. Cohen, President Trump’s former personal lawyer, mount an aggressive defense in the news media.
articles.abstract: Mr. Davis — an all-purpose lawyer, lobbyist, crisis consultant and TV-talker — has helped Mr. Cohen, President Trump’s former personal lawyer, mount an aggressive defense in the news media.
articles.lead_paragraph: Lanny J. Davis’s client list, like his quintessentially Washington career as an all-purpose lawyer, lobbyist, crisis consultant and television-talker, is lengthy, international — and more than occasionally contradictory.

articles.headline: Wages Are Rising in Europe. But Economists Are Puzzled.
articles.snippet: Increases in worker pay have given the European Central Bank confidence to end its main stimulus measure. Yet there is no consensus on why it took so long.
articles.abstract: Increases in worker pay have given the European Central Bank confidence to end its main stimulus measure. Yet there is no consensus on why it took so long.
articles.lead_paragraph: Workers may finally be getting a bigger piece of the economic pie — at least in Europe. Just don’t ask why, or whether it will last.

articles.headline: A Kushner Ally Was Up for a Federal Post. Then the F.B.I. Began Digging.
articles.snippet: Ken Kurson, a friend of Jared Kushner’s and a past adviser to Donald J. Trump, withdrew from consideration for a prestigious position amid harassment allegations.
articles.abstract: Ken Kurson, a friend of Jared Kushner’s and a past adviser to Donald J. Trump, withdrew from consideration for a prestigious position amid harassment allegations.
articles.lead_paragraph: Ken Kurson is a confidant of Rudolph W. Giuliani. He is a onetime speechwriter for Donald J. Trump. And he is a close friend of Jared Kushner, Mr. Trump’s son-in-law, who appointed Mr. Kurson to run his weekly newspaper, The New York Observer.
articles.byline: By Jesse Drucker, Emily Steel and Danny Hakim

articles.headline: The Rise, Fall and Rise Again of Imran Khan, Pakistan’s Next Leader
articles.snippet: The charismatic cricket star and bitter critic of the United States’ war on terrorism is on the cusp of becoming prime minister of the nuclear-armed nation.
articles.abstract: The charismatic cricket star and bitter critic of the United States’ war on terrorism is on the cusp of becoming prime minister of the nuclear-armed nation.
articles.lead_paragraph: LAHORE, Pakistan — Imran Khan, a charismatic cricket star who has fiercely criticized American counterterrorism policy in a region plagued by extremism, appeared poised on Thursday to become Pakistan’s next prime minister.

articles.headline: Facebook’s Stock Plunge Shatters Faith in Tech Companies’ Invincibility
articles.snippet: Roughly $120 billion in wealth was wiped out as Facebook shares fell 19 percent. It was among the largest one-day destruction a company has ever suffered.
articles.abstract: Roughly $120 billion in wealth was wiped out as Facebook shares fell 19 percent. It was among the largest one-day destruction a company has ever suffered.
articles.lead_paragraph: It had become an article of investor faith on Wall Street and in Silicon Valley: Quarter after quarter, year after year, the world’s biggest technology companies would keep raking in new users and ever-higher revenue. And with that, their share prices would continue to march upward, sloughing off any stumbles.
